questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.
You register two applications named App1 and App2 to Azure Active Directory (Azure AD).
You need to ensure that users who connect to App1 require multi-factor authentication (MFA). MFA is required only for App1.
What should you do?

choices.B: From Multi-Factor Authentication, configure the service settings.
choices.A: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, configure the Modern authentication settings.
choices.D: From the Azure Active Directory admin center, create a conditional access policy.
choices.C: From the Enterprise applications blade of the Azure Active Directory admin center, configure the Users settings.

discussion.content: MFA is configured through Conditional Access Policies

Selected Answer: D
Answer is correct

Pass all AAD signins to AD where the the logon hours are configured and applied.

questions.question_text:

For all user accounts, the Logon Hours settings are configured to prevent sign-ins outside of business hours.
You plan to sync contoso.com to an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant.
You need to recommend a solution to ensure that the logon hour restrictions apply when synced users sign in to Azure AD.
What should you include in the recommendation?

discussion.content:

Your network contains two disconnected on-premises Active Directory forests named adatum.com and contoso.com.

You have an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) tenant named nwtraders.com

You need to sync the on-premises forests to nwtraders.com. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Provide the ability to connect to adatum.com and contoso.com.
• Provide support for Microsoft Exchange hybrid.
• Provide the ability to sync device objects.
• Minimize administrative effort.

Which tool should you use for each requirement? To answer, drag the appropriate tools to the correct requirements. Each tool may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: Provided answer is wrong. ADMT is used for on-prem AD operations. First box should be Azure AD Connect as well, the other 2 answers are correct.

comments.content: You can't sync devices under single tenants from 2 different ADDS forest. You need to migrate on-prem objects under single forest and then use AADC.

discussion.content:
Perform the following steps to download the Microsoft Entra application proxy connector. The setup file you download is copied to your App Proxy VM in the next section.

Sign in to the Microsoft Entra admin center as a Global Administrator.

Search for and select Enterprise applications.

Select Application proxy from the menu on the left-hand side. To create your first connector and enable App Proxy, select the link to download a connector.

On the download page, accept the license terms and privacy agreement, then select Accept terms & Download.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory-domain-services/deploy-azure-app-proxy

This means you have to configure connector and its group first.
